content: The section describes the importance of features in building a machine learning model and the challenges that data scientists face when conducting exploratory data analysis, data preparation, and feature engineering. It proposes a new system called KGFarm, which aims to automate these tasks by leveraging the experience of data scientists working on similar problems and data. KGFarm employs machine learning and column statistics to discover entities and their corresponding features across schema-less data sources and automate tasks such as feature identification, data enrichment, data cleaning, data transformation, and feature selection. The section also compares KGFarm with state-of-the-art systems for entity discovery and data transformation recommendation to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach. Overall, it seems like KGFarm is an innovative solution that could potentially streamline the data preparation and feature engineering process for data scientists, promoting knowledge sharing and reducing the time and effort required for these tasks.
